name: abscond

abscond verb [I]
(ESCAPE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to go away suddenly and secretly in order to escape from somewhere: abscond from She absconded from boarding school and hitchhiked to the city. Two prisoners absconded last night.

abscond verb [I]
(STEAL)
to go away suddenly and secretly because you have stolen something, usually money: abscond with They think they know who absconded with the funds from the bake sale. abscond with humorous Someone absconded with my pen.
